sections.title: Miscellaneous
sections.description: Random snapshots from conferences and everyday lab life.

items.caption: I attended IEEE FIT'24 on December 9-10 where two of my papers were accepted.
Cowlar Inc. is the only Pakistani company backed by Y Combinator. Here's my desk — yes, the internet really is ~3 Gbps.
My four-screen workstation at Cowlar. It's fun to build with this much screen real estate.

sections.title: Visit to Edmonton, Canada (June – September 2024)
sections.description: My first time in North America was full of inspiring people, research conversations, and long summer days in Alberta.

items.caption: Heard Adam White speak in person after taking his Coursera RL course.
Presented my work at the Russ group meeting on Aug 30, 2024 — the questions were always razor sharp.
Professor Russ hosted a dinner — best desi food I had in Canada. In the picture: Anuradha, Pooja, Russ, Weijie, and me.
Presented at University of Alberta's ReverseExpo with Pooja.
Mitacs interns showcasing projects — I brought the glasses for professor vibes.
Anuradha, me, and Pooja after receiving our Mitacs Internship certificates.
Featured in Alberta's Senate Chamber alongside fellow Mitacs interns.
Officially receiving the Mitacs Internship certificate.
Central Academic Building (CAB) at University of Alberta became my second home.
Tried sparkling water for the first time at AMII's co-working space — verdict: interesting.
West Edmonton Mall — North America's largest mall.
This statue near campus clearly had a ridiculously low body-fat percentage.
My first attempt at ice skating — lots of slipping, zero regrets.
Heading home just before the rain in Edmonton.
Outside the parliament building in Alberta.
Spent three hours inside this corn maze before figuring out the exit.
Packing up to leave Edmonton — already nostalgic.
Flying over Montreal on the way back home.
